definition: to handle the situation calmly (idiom)/unruffled/to treat the situation lightly
Mt Tai 泰山[Tai4 Shan1] in Shandong/abbr. for Thailand
place/location/spot/point/office/department/bureau/respect/classifier for locations or items of damage: spot, point
to reside/to live/to dwell/to be in/to be situated at/to stay/to get along with/to be in a position of/to deal with/to discipline/to punish

sentences.english: No, she would have taken it calmly, and found pleasures therein.
sentences.chinese: 不會，她只會泰然處之，而且還要從中找到樂趣。

sentences.english: You must learn to play it cool.
sentences.chinese: 你必須學會遇事泰然處之。

sentences.english: But other days, I took it in stride.
sentences.chinese: 但是我轉念一想，就能泰然處之。

sentences.english: Granddaughterly." It's a role she occupies with great ease.
sentences.chinese: 像孫女一樣“這是她泰然處之的一個角色。

sentences.english: He has a southern drawl and is as cool as Mr Jobs runs hot.
sentences.chinese: 喬布斯急躁的時候，他卻可以泰然處之。
